item.description:
*************************************
Smithsonian Observatory

HARVARD-SMITHSONIAN CENTER FOR ASTROPHYSICS
60 GARDEN STREET
CAMBRIDGE, MA 02138
has their monthly public viewing this week on the 3rd Thursday night.

Drive up to the back, up the hill. The Lecture's up the stairs opposite the lil observatory-in-a-box.

*************************************
from the CfA:

"Searching for Planets with Kepler," Andrea Dupree, CfA
For centuries, philosophers, poets, and scientists alike have dreamed about planets similar to Earth circling other stars like our Sun. Now, astronomers have found more than 400 alien worlds, but none like Earth - yet. In the next two years, the first Earth twins may be located. Learn how astronomers detect extra-solar planets, and hear the current results from a new planet-hunting satellite named "Kepler" that's poised to make the first of these dramatic discoveries.

This event takes place at 7:30 pm on Thursday at Phillips Auditorium, 60 Garden Street, Cambridge. Doors open at 7:00. Get there EARLY... even before 6:45. Seating is first-come, first-served and admission is free. Free parking is available to everyone after 5 pm. (Ignore the "staff only" signs.)

If weather permits, rooftop observing through telescopes will follow the presentation.

For more information or directions, visit http://www.cfa.harvar... or call (617) 495-7461.
***********************************************
item.how_to_find_us: I'll carry a meetup sign before and afterwards... show up before 7 to get in.
item.name: Smithsonian Observatory Public Viewing Night
